s.text: Although this preparation was far from perfect, as Frederick Banting said in his Nobel lecture of 1925 (Nobel laureates did not have to wait so long as they do now for recognition), ÒThere was a marked reduction in blood sugar and the urine was rendered sugar free.Ó
But insulin's very success brought trouble, as demand far exceeded the supply.
But insulin's very success brought trouble, as demand far exceeded the supply.
